answers.answer: Have you talked with your doctor about it?  I'm assuming you did cause that seems to be a really serious thing to ask for advice about on an online forum....I would think and this is only my opinion that since the chemo destroys the good blood cells right along with the bad blood cells that is why you are sick afterwards and the blood transfusion replaces those good cells and restores a type of homeostatis to your body and you have a normal appetite.  Chemo has been proven to result in decreased appetite, nausea, vomiting in some cases, lethargy, decreased white cell count....The blood tranfusion returns the "good stuff" to your body!Hope all goes well....
